content.description: Very nice lieback diehedral climbing with good pro.
content.location:
This is the obvious, south-facing open book on the south side of Saddle Rocks, uphill of the walkoff/approach to "Boom Boom Room." and below and to the left of "Flakes Can Collapse." Descent is to the west.

FA unknown but we did this 12/95 and found an old rusted fixed pin near top which we cleaned.

content.description: Start just left of a large pine tree and climb up a ramp to meet a right-slanting crack which is followed right to reach a grainy vertical crack which is followed to the top.

climbs.name: Never Shake a Baby
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Andrea Tomaszewski, Mark Synek

content.description:
An easy crack on a ramp reaches a right-slanting crack where you can set some gear to stand up and clip the first bolt. The crux comes at you right away as you make height dependent moves up and left past the bolt to a gaping flake. Higher move up on questionable flakes to a delicate arete sequence and finish with some highsteps past a black intrusion to the anchors.

Great positioning but a little scrappy, although more traffic should help to clean it up.
content.location:
Left side of the rock and just right of

Short Story (aka White Torpedo)

.
